Hi Fransie,

Thanks for sending those through. I've just finished updating the partner logos on the homepage based on your document.
  • Logo Updates: I’ve updated the existing partner logos (except for those with same features) and added the new ones that weren't previously on the site.
  • Veterans Employment Logo: This has now been removed from the homepage as well, including the hero banner slideshow.

Please have a squiz when you have a moment and let me know if everything looks correct on your end!

Hi Adriane

The business representatives have reviewed the logos. Please find attached a Word document listing which logos should be included, along with a ZIP file containing the relevant logos.
Additionally, please remove the Veterans Employment logo from all areas of our site. Apologies for not informing you sooner about removing this logo.
If you have any questions or need further information, please let me know.

Regards

Fransie Bloem

Just a quick note to confirm that we’ve added the "Veterans’ Employment" badge to the new section as discussed. It looks much better there!

Next steps: We recommend replacing the current hero image slides (the ones containing the old badge) with "clean" versions that have no logos on them. This will prevent the badge from appearing twice and ensure a polished look.

If you can send over the new images, we will take care of that update for you immediately.

📝 Ticket Summary: Placement Suggestions for Veteran Employment Badge

Detail
Description
Subject
Design Suggestions for "Proud Supporter of Veterans' Employment" Badge
Client
Fransie Bloem (IT Operations Manager, Eptec Group)
Status
⏳ Pending Client Decision

Issue Description

Fransie required design input and placement suggestions for the "Proud Supporter of Veterans' Employment" badge on the homepage to ensure it appears visually balanced and professional.

Support Recommendations (Trust Signal Placement)

Support recommended treating the badge as a trust signal/accreditation rather than a header element, providing three placement options:
  1. Accreditation Strip (Recommended):
    • Placement: Move the badge to the existing grey scrolling bar/strip near the footer, alongside other partners (Ai Group, ICN).
    • Benefit: Positions the badge as a serious industry credential and balances the visual flow of the page.
  2. Site-Wide Footer:
    • Placement: Place the badge permanently in the site-wide footer, visible on all pages.
    • Benefit: Ensures high-end professional visibility and reinforces commitment across the entire site.
  3. Top Banner (Least Recommended):
    • Placement: If it must remain near the top, detach it from the main company logo and place it in the bottom-right corner of the hero image as a standalone "stamp."

Support Recommendation: Option 1 (Accreditation Strip) was recommended for the best integration with the existing layout and professional aesthetic.

Hi Fransie,

To resolve this, I recommend we treat the “Proud Supporter of Veterans' Employment” badge as a trust signal rather than part of your header. Here are the best options for a professional layout:

  1. Accreditation Strip (Best for User Experience):
    Move the badge down to the grey scrolling bar near the footer, alongside your other partners (Ai Group, ICN). This positions the badge as a serious industry credential and balances the page visually.

  2. Footer (Best for Visibility):
    Place the badge permanently in the site-wide footer. This looks very high-end and ensures visitors see your commitment to veterans on every page, not just the homepage.

  3. Top Banner (If it must stay near the logo):
    Detach it from the Eptec logo and place it in the bottom-right corner of the hero image as a standalone “stamp.”

My recommendation would be Option 1, as it integrates nicely with your existing layout while keeping the homepage clean and professional.

Let me know which approach you prefer! Always happy to help.

Hi Adriana

Please provide suggestions regarding the "Proud Supporter of Veterans' Employment" badge.

Thanks

Fransie Bloem

Just wanted to follow up regarding the “Proud Supporter of Veterans' Employment” badge on the homepage. We’re happy to provide design suggestions to ensure it’s displayed in a visually balanced and professional way.

No rush at all - just let us know what works best for you.
